content.description: In a crag destined to become a sport climbing haven, this is an obvious trad line. Follow the wide crack in the center of the face up through the dihedral finish. Don't be fooled by the grade; expect to run out a couple sections due to poor protection options. I think this adds to the fun factor of the route. Many loose rocks and a few dead bushes were cleaned out. Several questionable hand/foot options remain. Tread cautiously.
content.protection: Gear is a standard rack with emphasis on larger pro. Extend the belay from the large boulder a few paces back and to the left. Use a dedicated rope/cordage for a TR anchor or simply belay up your second (recommended).
